content.question: The Atwoodâ€™s machine shown consists of two blocks of mass <math alttext="m sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> and <math alttext="m sub 2 " overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> that are connected by a light string that passes over a pulley of negligible friction and negligible mass. The block of mass <math alttext="m sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> is a distance <math alttext="h sub 1 " overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> above the ground, and the block of mass <math alttext="m sub 2 " overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> is a distance <math alttext="h sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> above the ground. <math alttext="m sub 2 " overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> is larger than <math alttext="m sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>. The two-block system is released from rest. Which of the following claims correctly describes the outcome after the blocks are released from rest but before the block of <math alttext="m sub 2 " overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> reaches the ground? Select two answers.

choices.label: For the system consisting of the two blocks, the change in the kinetic energy of the system is equal to the work done by gravity on the system.

For the system consisting of the two blocks, the change in kinetic energy of the system is equal to the sum of <math alttext="m sub 1, end sub, g h sub 1, end sub, plus m sub 2, end sub, g h sub 2, end sub" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mi>g</mi><msub><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mi>g</mi><msub><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.
For the system consisting of the two blocks and the pulley, the increase in kinetic energy of the system is equal to the decrease in the gravitational potential energy of the system.
For the system consisting of the two blocks, the pulley, and Earth, the change in the total mechanical energy of the system is zero.

content.answer: For the system consisting of the two blocks, the change in the kinetic energy of the system is equal to the work done by gravity on the system.
